normalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices

unnormalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices
normalised: Like many, I started yoga searching for a quick fix. Stress from work deadlines, the constant Nagpur heat, and the general chaos of life had me feeling perpetually on edge. A friend, Priya, suggested trying a beginner's class at the Isha Yoga Center nearby. Honestly, I was skeptical. I imagined bendy, lithe individuals contorting themselves into impossible shapes. Me, barely able to touch my toes, didn't quite fit that picture.

normalised: The first class was, well, humbling. Surya Namaskar felt less like a graceful flow and more like a series of awkward stumbles. But something clicked. The quiet focus, the deep breaths, the gentle stretching – it was different from anything I'd experienced before. Doctor Sharma, the instructor, emphasized listening to your body and honoring its limits. No pressure to become a yoga master overnight.

normalised: Gradually, yoga became more than just a workout. I started incorporating pranayama techniques, like Anulom Vilom, into my daily routine. The calmness it brought during stressful meetings was remarkable! I even carved out a small yoga space, about one hundred square feet, in my apartment.

normalised: Now, a few months in, I'm still far from achieving those Instagram-worthy poses. But I’ve found a consistency I never thought possible. Some days it’s a full sixty minute session, others just a quick fifteen minute stretch before bed. I’ve even persuaded my mom to join me for online classes! She’s convinced it’s helping her with her back pain, which, after years of lugging heavy shopping bags from the market, is a huge win.

normalised: Yoga, for me, isn't about achieving perfect postures; it's about cultivating a deeper connection with myself, about finding that inner 'shanti' amidst the daily hustle. And knowing that even just five minutes of mindful breathing can make a world of difference is a pretty powerful thing. The cost, roughly rupee five hundred per class, feels well worth the investment in my well-being. My next goal? Mastering Sirsasana! Wish me luck!
